intro: Calycadenia hooveri, commonly known as Hoover's globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid environments. It has hairy, glandular stems and leaves that help reduce water loss. Its ecological importance includes providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a food source for certain wildlife.
